--- In nbwrpg@y..., "LurkerAbyss" <1641coburn@r...> wrote:
> OOC:  I might be wrong, but I'm pretty sure that  the difference is
that, an android is  part organic, but is  truely techno.  And a
cyborg, is part techno, but truely organic.  These are usually used
for part-techno, part-human.  But in transformers case, most would be
"androids", because  they are originally techno  but take on some
organic.  But for transformers, wouldn't they be called "techno-organic"?

I think an android is a robot built to look human.
